definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: U. S. military radar anti-jamming technology, it will be privatized.
sentences.chinese: 美國的軍工雷達抗干擾技術，我們將它民營化。

sentences.english: What will drive the privatization of Chinese universities?
sentences.chinese: 如何推動中國大學民營化呢？

sentences.english: It is against this background that this paper is to study the topic of privatization of Pinggang Steel.
sentences.chinese: 本論文正是在此背景下研究萍鋼民營化這一課題。

sentences.english: As a result, the institution design of privatization policy was guite important.
sentences.chinese: 因此，對於民營化政策的制度設計就顯得更爲重要。

sentences.english: Privatization is a kind of trend all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 民營化是全球的一種趨勢。

sentences.english: The private management of public services has become a worldwide trend.
sentences.chinese: 公共服務民營化現已成爲一種世界性潮流。

sentences.english: Taiwan's Tobacco and Wine Monopoly Bureau is about to be privatized.
sentences.chinese: 臺灣的於酒公賣局即將民營化。

sentences.english: The other consequence of privatization was the oligarchy politics came out.
sentences.chinese: 民營化的一個結果是寡頭政治的出現。
